Energy infrastructure was hit in Kharkiv
Large fires are burning in Kharkiv City from the KAB strikes.

I'm going to monitor the situation closely tonight. There may be a big attack on Ukraine's energy infrastructure.  I want to reiterate that nothing is certain at this moment!
Its nearly 11pm in Ukraine, and there are still very few drones detected in Ukrainian airspace. No new info about potential missile threats.

A short time ago, at least two Russian KAB glide-bombs launched from a Su-34 struck the Korobelnyi District of Kherson City. At the time, 3 reconnaissance drones were operating over the eastern suburbs of the city. Power outages were subsequently reported.

A short time ago, at least two Russian KAB glide-bombs launched from a Su-34 struck the Korobelnyi District of Kherson City. At the time, 3 reconnaissance drones were operating over the eastern suburbs of the city. Power outages were subsequently reported.

Earlier today, a Russian Iskander-M ballistic missile launched from Millerovo Airbase, Rostov oblast, impacted the city of Slovyansk, Donetsk Oblast.
Media 1 shows the aftermath, but the exact target is currently unknown. No civilian casualties were reported.

Why is it that Pro-Russians and Pro-Ukrainians just cannot resist from attacking neutral, reliable mappers and Osinters?

The problem with fanatics is that they take every advance made by the side they support as correct and ignore those made by the opposition. However, they then cannot explain why a particular location has not yet been taken/recaptured because the reality is much more complex.
PS: For God's sake, people are dying in combat and you're complaining about how a map (which shows an approximate but never an exact situation of the ground) is painted, you bastards. Show some respect and consideration for human lives, this isn't a fucking video game.

Pay or Fight: The Corrupt Business of Mobilization in Ukraine
The activities of the Territorial Recruitment Centers (TRCs) in Ukraine continue to spark intense public debate. Social media is regularly flooded with videos showing how TRC staff and police forcibly seize men right off the streets, blatantly ignoring their documents confirming deferments, reservations, or health issues.
Simultaneously, reports are emerging of a new mobilization scheme involving putting employees of defense enterprises on a wanted list. Valeriy Borovik, founder of the Ukrainian defense company First Contact, reported that his company submits documents to reserve an employee, only for that same employee to be listed as wanted by the TRC just hours later, making it impossible to secure their reservation. To remove a person from the wanted list, a fine must be paid. 
üëâ

Hamas Is Purging Gaza Of ‚ÄòCollaborators‚Äô (18+ Video)
Hamas deployed its fighters in several parts of the Gaza Strip to hunt down people accused of conducting criminal activities or even collaborating with Israel after the ceasefire deal brokered by the United States went into effect.
The fighters were seen in several parts of the Strip on October 13, after the group released all living hostages. Some were wearing a shoulder patch identifying them as members of the elite "Shadow Unit,‚Äù which was reportedly tasked with guarding the hostages.
While Hamas fighters emerged only after the release of the hostages, clashes with alleged criminals and collaborators first broke out the moment the ceasefire went into effect on October 10. The most noticeable battle was in Gaza City, where Hamas conducted an operation against the Doghmosh clan.

Ukraine's Manpower Crisis: Systemic Failures and the Dilemma of Military Desertion
Ukraine faces a critical and growing manpower crisis, compounded by systemic corruption and mass desertion. With 1.5 million citizens evading draft and a quarter-million estimated deserters, official attempts to solve the problem are creating new dilemmas. The recent decriminalization of desertion backfired, and re-criminalizing it now threatens to overburden the state‚Äôs judicial and penal systems.
Galina Yanchenko, a Ukrainian parliamentarian, stated that, as of October, around 1.5 million Ukrainian citizens are wanted by the Armed Forces of Ukraine‚Äôs territorial recruitment centres. This figure only includes those who have not yet been drafted.
An interesting hierarchy of payments has been established in Ukraine for detentions by TRC (Territorial recruitment centers) employees, which increases exponentially at each stage. 
üëâ
